div.div: This search form uses an instant search feature. As you type, search results will appear automatically below the search field. When you've entered you desired search terms use tab to navigate through the available results and hit enter to open the selected page or document.

div.h3: Continuing to Build Positive & Effective LearningÂ Communities

div.p: Check out MOSTA with their teacher shout out video! https://youtu.be/i85_mP8Nkwo Don't forget to share and subscribe to our YouTube channel! #MOSTA #engagement #Super163 #elevatingexcellence

Hello District 163 Families. 3rd Quarter Report Cards are available today, April 9th. Please access through Skyward. If you need assistance or are unable to access the internet please contact your child's Principal or the Skyward Help Desk at (708) 668-9485.

Hello District 163, please see the Remote Learning Plan Updates for important information. Visit sd163.com School Closure Updates. Reminder April 8th and April 9th are teacher planning days. These will not be instructional days for students. Please visit the Resource page for student activities.
Good morning SD 163 Community! We've updated the Curbside Grab and Go dates and time. Please see flyer or visit our district website for more information. #elevatingexcellence #Super163!

Good afternoon SD 163 Community. Please make sure you are checking our District Website (sd163.com) for continuous updates for student information in the News section. Please stay safe. #elevatingexcellence #Super163

p.a: Event: 3rd Grade Hands On The Arts & STEM

District 163 School Closure Information Updated April 18, 2020
Â Â

Governor Pritzker has announced that all Illinois public schools will be closed through the end of the 2019-20 school year due to the COVID19 health crisis. Â While this saddens us that we are unable to resume face to face learning, our hope is that the health and wellness of our community will benefit by everyone staying home and social distancing.Â

We will continue to provide education through remote learning materials, Curbside Grab and Go meals ensuring that nutritional needs are met, and ongoing communication with families to share information.Â Principals, teachers and school staff will connect with families via online platforms, email and/or phone to support needs, provide feedback and log daily attendance.Â
Students may access remote learning materials two ways:Â

p.span: 1. Digital remote learning electronic messages from the teacher by 9:30 a.m. daily

2. Non-digital remote learning paper packets may be picked up at any of our six schools for any grade level at the Curbside Meals Grab and Go stations between 9:00 and 11:00 a.m.Â Please practice social distancing in accordance with the Governorâ€™s Executive Order and Center for Disease Control recommendations when picking up meals and materials.

div.p: The Governorâ€™s announcement impacts our end of year events. Communications will be shared soon with information related to spring registration, graduation activities and other important end of the year events. Â Thank you for your patience as we plan.Â Â We miss you and look forward to our return to school! Stay well! Â Â
Â
Sincerely,Â
Dr. Caletha White, Superintendent
